description: Amalgamation of 2 existing self-contained residential flats to reinstate the property as a single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3). The erection of a single storey wrap around extension at ground floor and the erection of an additional storey to the rear outrigger and associated external alterations. Alterations to front garden and boundary wall.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>The development hereby approved shall provide two bee bricks and two swift boxes close to the eaves prior to first occupation and shall be retained as such in perpetuity.<br><br>REASON: In the interest of biodiversity.</p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>All new works in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.

</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure a satisfactory external appearance.</p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-7848ec30-7fff-977b-45c5-bec4d7918ca9"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Replacement windows shall accurately replicate, in terms of material, profile and detailing, the original windows surviving to the property. They shall be painted timber, double-hung 2/2 sash windows with a slim profile and narrow integral (not applied) glazing bars with a putty finish (not timber bead). The glazing shall be no greater than 12mm (4mm glass : 4mm gas : 4mm glass) in total thickness. No trickle vents or metallic/perforated spacer bars are permitted. </span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-7848ec30-7fff-977b-45c5-bec4d7918ca9"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the character and appearance of the Victoria Park Conservation Area under Sections 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2024, Paragraphs 202 to 221; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f3a423b7-7fff-d7c2-0e45-2e077c8c883b"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The following elements of the scheme shall not be installed, implemented or carried out unless in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details. </span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f3a423b7-7fff-d7c2-0e45-2e077c8c883b"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">a) External doors including cills, heads and reveals;</span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f3a423b7-7fff-d7c2-0e45-2e077c8c883b"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">b) Details of proposed windows at 1:20 and 1:5 including elevations and cross sections; and</span></span></p><p>c) Details of proposed railings</p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f3a423b7-7fff-d7c2-0e45-2e077c8c883b"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the character and appearance of the Victoria Park Conservation Area under Sections 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2024, Paragraphs 202 to 221; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</span></span></p>

<p>The window hereby approved at second floor to the eastern side elevation as shown on approved drawings P103 00 and P107 00 shall be fitted with obscured glazing to Pilkington Level 3 and shall be non-opening unless the opening parts are 1.7 metres above internal finished floor level. The window shall be thereafter maintained in perpetuity.</p><p>REASON: To safeguard neighbouring amenity.</p>
